titleInfo.title: Correlated sources help transmission over an arbitrarily varying channel

mods.abstract: It is wed known that the deterministic code capacity (for the average error probability criterion) of an arbitrarily varying channel (AVC) either equals Its random code capacity or zero, Here it is shown that if two components of a correlated source are additionally available to the sender and receiver, respectively, the capacity always equals its random code capacity.
